*The Supreme Clarity Northern Culmen Celestial Heart Orthodox Method*

*The Scripture of the Supreme Clarity Northern Culmen Celestial Heart Orthodox Method* is of unknown authorship, emerging during the Southern Song dynasty. It comprises a single fascicle. The base text is derived from the *Zhengtong Daoist Canon*, under the category of Methods in the Cavernous Mystery Division.

**The Celestial Heart Method**

The Celestial Heart Method was bestowed by the Most High upon Mount Cranecall, where daily he instructed the Celestial Master in the scriptures of the Northern Culmen, its purpose being to repel and expel demonic forces and to deliver the people. Of old, the transmitted Celestial Heart Orthodox Method consisted solely of three talismans: first, the Talisman of the Great Sage of the Celestial Pivot; second, the Talisman of the Black Destructor; and third, the Three Luminaries Talisman.

As for the Three Luminaries Talisman, it is bound above to the Three Sovereigns, its Dao resonating with the Three Realms, its virtue manifesting the Three Powers, and its truth issuing from the Three Masters—thus is it named the Celestial Heart. It is the origin of the myriad Dao, the progenitor of all methods.

Master Void Tranquility stated: There are two seals. The first is the Seal of the Northern Culmen Demon-Quelling Court, also called the Seal of the Lord of All-Heaven, Commander of Ghosts and Spirits Across the Three Realms. The second is the Seal of the Great Dharma Lord of All-Heaven. Simple yet not cumbersome, they were entrusted to extraordinary individuals and transmitted through the ages.

When a Dharma officer enters the afflicted household, he employs the method of transformation.

When entering an afflicted household, perform the Ninefold Stem of the Celestial Pole, and visualize yourself as the Primordial Sovereign. The Nine Phoenixes of the South spew true fire, reducing the stricken dwelling to ashes that scatter on the wind. A single gust from the Thunder Wind purifies all, transforming it into a towering palace—the Hall of Golden Splendor. Its inhabitants become celestial immortals, and beneath the palace, nine giant turtles soar. The lofty towers are wreathed in purple mist, while myriad golden rays burst forth from Fusang.

On all sides stretch vast seas, their waves surging and boiling without bound. The endless billows span ten thousand leagues, devoid of boats or oars. I then enter, wielding the Celestial Pole, transforming into the Primordial Sovereign to command the armored hosts. The Orthodox Unity of the Mysterious Center attends my body, while the Four Saints, the Three Officials, and the marshals, along with the Six Jia and Six Ding spirits, all descend. The Azure Dragon, White Tiger, Vermilion Bird, Dark Warrior, Qilin, and Master Phoenix soar forth. Thunder and lightning clash as they advance before me, while my body, imbued with the Five Pecks of qi, conceals the hun-souls.

The Celestial Pole’s crimson qi clears the path ahead, as iron nets weave above and below. On all ten sides and eight directions, soldiers and generals stand arrayed, their banners and standards lining the ranks of ten thousand troops. Knocking the teeth to gather the spirits and circulating the Three qi, recite the incantation to slay ghosts—naturally efficacious.

**Transformation of the Vast Sea Mudra:**
Clasp the *hai* position, press the upper *jia* to the fourth, third, and second fingernails below. Flick outward to manifest a vast sea, boundless and indistinct, its waves spanning ten thousand leagues, encircling the dwelling on all sides.

**Mudra of the Void Sovereign’s Terrace:**
Press the *chou* position with the thumb, then trace upward to *wu*. Flick outward to transform the house into a divine immortal’s palace, its twelve steps aligned with the *ding* and *wai* positions. Gargle water three times, shout the transformation thrice, and with eyes closed, visualize the dwelling as twelve towering pavilions. Bones and flesh become immortals, jade maidens revel above, while below, giant turtles bear them to and fro across the fathomless sea.

**Mudra of the Boat and Oars:**
Press the *yin* position with the thumb, then rotate sequentially to *hai*. Flick outward to visualize the sea devoid of boats or oars, leaving ghosts and spirits without passage.

**Mudra of the Four Quadrants’ Iron Barrier Reaching Heaven:**
Right hand facing upward, left hand facing downward, the right hand’s second fingernail presses the root of the left hand’s second finger. The left thumb presses the right hand’s third finger, then the right hand’s fourth finger passes over the back to meet the middle finger’s middle joint, pressing the upper segment. The five fingers press the backs of the left hand’s five fingernails. Bend and straighten the right hand’s second finger, visualizing an iron barrier stretching from heaven to earth, sealing off malevolent spirits and blocking all entry.

When the Dharma master departs, he rides a black cloud across the sea, dissolving the iron barrier—opening before and closing behind. Stand with feet together, then step forward and close behind.

**Purification of the Altar Incantation:**
Above in heaven, below on earth,
Mighty Heavenly Ding spirits,
Assist my Dharma,
Sweep away demonic miasma.
Foul qi swiftly perish,
Demonic miasma cleansed.
May the altar be swiftly purified,
The Dao’s qi eternally abide.
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and ordinance!*

**Left Hand’s Slaying Mudra:**
Draw the qi of the Heavenly Gate, enter water, and sprinkle to purify.

**Purification of the Body Incantation:**
Supreme Perfected, Mysterious Numinous,
Five Pecks of qi cover my body.
Spirit clear, qi refreshed,
Foulness dispelled, peace restored.
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the Most High’s statutes and ordinances!*

**Left Hand’s Yaksha Mudra:**
Form the mudra, draw the qi of the Heavenly Gate, and blow.

**Purification of the Heart Incantation:**
Five qi, true and numinous,
Heaven’s image transforms.
Assist and guard,
Heart and spirit unerring.
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the Most High’s statutes and ordinances!*

**Left Hand’s Celestial Heart Mudra:**
From the third finger, press into the palm’s center.

**Transformation of Form Incantation:**
By the decree of the Three Heavens,
Transform my form.
Azure Dragon, White Tiger,
Attend and guard my body.
Evil ghosts flee afar,
True qi swiftly arises.
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the Most High’s statutes and ordinances!*

**Left Hand’s Celestial Heart Mudra, Right Hand’s Dipper Seal:**
Visualize oneself in the likeness of the Heavenly Master.

**Concealing the Hun-Souls into the Dipper Incantation:**
I receive the Heavenly Master’s Heart Treasure Seal,
Endowed by nature,
Communing with the hidden and reaching the netherworld,
Ascending through the grotto-heavens.
I tread the Yu step, aspiring to transcendence.
Three Hun Spirits,
*Left hand forms the Three Terraces Mudra,*
Draw the qi of the Three Luminaries,
Visualize the Three Terraces at the left shoulder—these are the Three Hun.
Seven Po Immortals,
*Right hand forms the Northern Dipper Mudra,*
The third fingertip inhales seven breaths of qi,
Seven stars reside at the right mansion—these are the Seven Po.
Follow my Yu step,
Aspiring to cross the numinous barrier.
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and ordinance!*

**Stepping the Huoluo Dipper:**
After the Summer Solstice, lead with the right foot.
After the Winter Solstice, lead with the left foot.
On yang days: *"The Dipper’s mystery, ah—twelve celestial hours."*
On yin days: *"Sun and moon shine bright, Heaven and Earth unite."*
The *Hetu* conceals the spirits within the Nine-Palace Dipper—
*Wearing nine atop, treading one below, three to the left, seven to the right.*
*Two and four as shoulders, six and eight as feet.*
*Five dwells within, forming the solid belly.*
*A thousand evils, ten thousand ghosts—all submit as guests.*
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and ordinance!*

**Heavenly Heart Summoning Generals Incantation:**
*Left: the Demon-Queller. Right: the Firmament.*
Six Jia spirit-generals—
*Swiftly summon the true general, hasten to descend!*
By the Emperor’s decree, obey and act accordingly.
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and ordinance!*
*Right hand forms the Dipper Mudra, Heaven’s Gate qi summons the generals—use as desired.*

**Talisman-Writing Visualization Formula:**
First, purify the heart—banish stray thoughts.
Sit facing the established direction, toward the breaking point.
Visualize the Three Clarities, gaze upward into the void.
Command the Four Sages, the ten thousand soldier-generals.
Envision my body assuming the exorcising form.
Five Dippers’ radiance conceals my shape.
Step forward onto the Firmament, kick back onto the Yang Path.
My body shines bright—Three Luminaries descend.
Inhale into the mouth, without error or delusion.
*Fire of the Great Yang descends from Mao.*
*Water of the Great Yin descends from You.*
*The Heavenly Firmament Star descends from the center.*
*Purple, white, red—three hues in form.*
Envelop my body—ten thousand evils chant in submission.
Knock the teeth nine times—four great [elements] flow unimpeded.
Three Fields’ light—my body grows mighty.
Now write the talisman—this is the Dharma treasury.

**Heavenly Heart General Incantation:**
*Vast and formless, the primordial chaos—*
*Within, the written script.*
*Ocean’s depths pour forth clarity.*
*Chou.*

Radiant brilliance blazes forth—*Yin*.
Resplendent flames surge—*Mao*.
Azure Emperor convenes the spirits—*Mao*.
White Emperor resides in *You*.
Crimson Emperor nurtures qi—*Wu*.
Black Emperor channels blood—*Zi*.
Yellow Emperor presides at the center—*Center*.

One, five, three transformations—left hand forms three coins.
Dispersed into ten thousand distinctions—*return to Chou*.
Wind—*Yin*.
Convergence—*Mao*.
Numinous—*Chen*.
Stillness—*Si*.
Vastness—*Wu*.
Resonance—*Wei*.
Permeation—*Shen*.
Attunement—*You*.
Only the true—*Xu*.
Only the responsive—*Xu*.
Evil rebellion—*Hai*.
Dare to sprout—*Zi*.
Purify and govern—*Chou*.
Thus govern—*Center*.

By the Dharma summon the spirits, by the spirits summon qi—*Wu*.
Condense it naturally—press the center finger against the thumbnail.
Circulating through Heaven and Earth—*Wu*.
The Heavenly Heart bears command—*Wu*.
All spirits reverently heed—*center script*.

One net severs baleful forces—*center above*.
Three Greedy Wolves receive the decree—*center one*.
Three Ketu seize—*center script*.

*Oṃ □□lī □□li svāhā*—the summoned [General] so-and-so, hasten here swiftly.
Extend the center finger’s lower mudrā.

*Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the Jade Purity’s decree, summoning all spirits by this present command!*

**Heavenly Heart Dharma Division Generals and Officers—Attire, Names, and Titles:**

**Marshal of the All-Heaven Enforcing Evil, Zhang Tingzhong:**
Disheveled hair, crimson robe, golden armor, wields a sword.

**Marshal of the Heaven-Spanning Slayer, Zhu Zizhen:**
Disheveled hair, azure robe, golden armor, holds a noose.

**Marshal of the Heaven-Piercing Seizer, Su Chengli:**
Disheveled hair, yellow robe, golden armor, grasps a sword.

**Marshal of the Golden Heaven Fire Wheel, Zheng Tianying:**
Disheveled hair, black robe, golden armor, bears a staff.

**Marshal of the Flying Golden Sage, Zhao Tianzheng:**
Disheveled hair, white robe, golden armor, wields a cangue.

**Marshal of the Blazing Sky Flying Wheel, Wang Huoguang:**
Disheveled hair, scarlet robe, golden armor, holds a fire wheel.

**Marshal of the Soaring Empyrean Evil-Destroyer, Liu Cishen:**
Disheveled hair, purple robe, golden armor, grips a blade.

**Marshal of the Cinnabar-Azure Sage Spirit, Hu Zhongyuan:**
Disheveled hair, black robe, golden armor, bears a staff.

**Marshal of the Spirit-Calming Soul-Stabilizer, Ju Zizhen:**
Disheveled hair, variegated robe, golden armor, staff and sword.

**Marshal of the Soul-Pursuing Soul-Returner, Du Gangzhi:**
Disheveled hair, azure robe, golden armor, wields a blade.

**Marshal of the Dharma-Prohibiting Divine Penetration, Yao Yaozhen:**
Disheveled hair, green robe, golden armor, staff and sword.

**Marshal of the Phantom-Pursuing Specter-Captor, Xu Tianxin:**
Disheveled hair, yellow-flowered robe, golden armor, holds a blade.

**Marshal of the Mountain-Leaping Sea-Entering, Yuan Tongling:**
Disheveled hair, azure robe, golden armor, staff and sword.

The thirteen great marshals above all belong to the Northern Court,
the Northern Culmen Heavenly Heart Chancellery,
the Northern Culmen Orthodox Dharma Chancellery.

**Celestial Heart Orthodox Dharma Seal and Talismanic Script**
**The True Talisman of the Heavenly Stem Great Sage for Exorcising Ghosts by Imperial Decree**

As the Daoist scriptures state: The Heavenly Stem Great Sage is invoked to repel disasters for the state. When the sun and moon lose their proper course, when comets appear in daylight, when drought, flood, locusts, or pestilence rage, when malevolent spirits and ghosts enter the land or manifest, when grotesque and monstrous forms invade human dwellings, hurling bricks and tiles, summoning winds and setting fires, bewildering the living—then inscribe the True Form Talisman of the Heavenly Stem. Visualize the Breaker of Armies, aligning it correctly as prescribed.

On the preceding night, prepare incense, flowers, wine, and fruit to honor the Heavenly Stem Great Sage, and leave brush and ink exposed beneath the talisman. At dawn, banish all extraneous thoughts, purify body and mind, and inscribe the talisman according to the method.

**The "Heaven" Character Form**
**The "Stem" Character Form**
**The "Great" Character Form**
**The "Sage" Character Form**
**The "Decree" Character Form**
**The "Slay" Character Form**

While inscribing the talisman, recite the Heavenly Stem Mantra and Decree. Visualize the true *qi* of the Heavenly Regulator, the Star of the Demon-Quelling Venerable, entering the talisman. Clasp the Stem and Eye mudras.

For warding homes and expelling evil, this method yields profound efficacy. Alternatively, hand over the talisman, spray water, and clench the Sword Mudra, declaring:

*"Celestial Spirit, Earthly Spirit,
The Three and Five conjoin in harmony.
By Imperial Decree I act,
To scrutinize and bind wayward spirits.
Direct-Day Merit Officers,
Attending officials and marshals,
Delay not, tarry not—
Hasten forth, return swiftly,
For I await in command."*

**Next, Circulate the Thunder Formation**

*"Heavenly Thunder rumbles low—*Zi.
*Earth Thunder, Yin Thunder, Yang Thunder—*
Thunder’s might stirs and shakes.
Dragon and Tiger cross paths,
Sun and Moon array in order—*Yin.
Radiance shines clear—*Mao.
Twelve Merit Officers—*Chen.
Five Thunder Envoys,
Six Jia and Six Ding,
Bear the talisman forth—*Wu Tiao.
Swift as law commands!"*

**First Revolution:** Six Spirits conceal—*Yin* to *Mao.*
**Second Revolution:** Four Malevolents vanish—*Chen.*
**Third Revolution:** The Stem and Culmen move—*Wu.*
**Fourth Revolution:** Thunderfire surges—*Zi.*
**Fifth Revolution:** Thunderbolts strike—*You.*
**Sixth Revolution:** Mountain ghosts perish—*Xu.*
**Seventh Revolution:** All rebels against Heaven, all lawless specters with severed feet, are seized.

*"Whatever demonic affliction plagues this body,
Come before my Stem and Culmen,
Beneath the Five Thunders,
To meet your death—
Move not, act not!
Swift as law commands!"*

**Mantra and Mudra for Circulating the Thunder Formation**
When circulating thunder, use the mudra to stir the Kidney Palace, raising the Kidney Water upward while the Heart Fire’s red *qi* descends, merging with the Kidney *qi*. The two *qi* blend and fuse, generating thunder and lightning.

Circulate with both hands in the Thunder Formation, guiding it to the crown of the head. Extend the mudra, cover the ears to produce thunder, flash the eyes thrice for lightning, exhale through the nose for wind, expel breath from the mouth for clouds, and spray water thrice for rain.

Send forth the talisman with the dispatching mudra, transforming and invoking the talismanic water. The bearer becomes a Heavenly Ding Warrior or the Direct-Day Merit Officer. For hastening childbirth, the bearer becomes the Hastening Birth Lad or the Birth-Supervising Great Spirit. The talisman-bearer must not pause or rest along the way.

**Ancient Three Lights Talisman**
Before inscribing the talisman, sit facing the Destruction Palace, cast the *Zi-Wu* Dipper, and cover the body as prescribed. Invoke *qi* into the cinnabar inkwell, visualizing radiance filling the vessel. Recite the incantation:

*"The Great Sun shines true,
Evil ghosts wane in its light.
Divine cinnabar gleams bright as day,
Ninefold dew from the Supreme Canopy.
Three *qi* form the Terrace,
Seven *qi* form the Dipper.
Both stars shine forth—
Where the talisman arrives, pursuit is certain.
Ink becomes the divine sword,
Brush the halberd and glaive.
Inkstone the Dragon Pool,
Water the Dragon Ford.
By brushwork, illness is cured,
All evil vanishes.
As the law commands!"*

Next, clasp the Sun Lord Mudra at the upper joint of the left middle finger.

**Round Radiance, Square Image, Round Shadow Talisman**
Recite the Sun Mantra. Visualize the purple *qi* of the sun, nine-rayed, blown into the talisman with the *Tiao* mudra.
Recite the Moon Mantra. Visualize the white *qi* of the moon, ten-rayed, blown into the talisman with the *Tiao* mudra.
Seven revolutions.
Recite from *Kui* to *Piao*. Clasp the *Chen* mudra, draw the Stem into the talisman.
Upon completing the form, recite the invocation for the Heavenly Stem Great Sage to descend, infusing the true *qi* into the ghost’s heart.

**Five Fires Three Lights Talisman**
**Talisman-Consecrating Mantra**

The talismans of Heaven are efficacious,
The talismans of Earth are efficacious.
The Six Jia and Six Ding spirits seize all demonic essences.
When the talisman arrives, all maladies are cured.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the law commands!

**Another Talisman: Five Fires Three Lights Talisman**
Upon completing the inscription of the right talisman,
Recite the Stem Mantra, then the Consecration Mantra of Heavenly Emperor Śakra.
Further recite the *Hun* and *Yuepo* Mantras, dispatching the divine generals forth.
Within the Thunder Formation, draw *qi* into the water.

**Great Three Lights Talisman**
**Black Malevolence True Form Talisman**

In the practice of the Dao, nothing precedes the drawing of *qi*.
For when *qi* is correct, the talisman is efficacious;
When the general is correct, the method is verified.
There has never been one who practiced without knowing the pathways of *qi*.
Though the methods and gates are manifold, none have definitively expounded them.
The method of drawing *qi* takes the Three Lights as its essence in the *Tianxin Zhengfa*.
The Numinous Writ of the Southern Quarter takes the Vermilion Mound as its root,
Yet does not reveal the Vermilion Mound’s directional mantras.
The various numinous writs of the schools merely record the drawing of *qi* from a given direction,
Without pointing to its source.
Thus, those who transmit the teachings to later learners err in a hundred ways.
When talismanic water fails to respond, they blame the Great Dao,
Unknowing that the fault lies in the transmission itself—how pitiable!
Herein it is set forth in full.
Those who delve deeply into it shall find it most fitting.

The *Shangqing* Method of Ingesting the Flying Root and Vermilion Essence Golden Elixir

Each day at the hour of solar culmination, face the sun with eyes slightly opened. Knock the teeth nine times, silently invoke the names of the solar soul and the characters of the Five Emperors within the sun. With hands clasped, call forth the solar soul.

The Five Emperors sit according to the five directions, with the sun at their center. The solar soul is the essence of the sun, the vermilion *qi* within it. The Most August True Lord, named General, styled Gaoqian, must not be casually invoked—know him through visualization.

**Zhujing** – Solar Soul
*Illuminating Radiance* (Green Emperor): Yuanchangwu, styled Zhaotao, appears as an infant clad in azure jade brocade, with a verdant floral flying feather skirt and a kingfisher-feathered dawn crown. He rides the sunlight to stand at one’s left.

*Vermilion Glow* (Red Emperor): Danlingzhi, styled Lü Hongying, appears as an infant clad in crimson jade brocade, with a white feathered floral flying skirt and a cinnabar dawn crown. He emerges from the sun’s rays to stand at one’s right.

*Returning Radiance* (White Emperor): Haoyujiang, styled Huijin Xia, appears as an infant clad in white jade brocade, with a white feathered floral flying skirt and a luminous dawn crown. He arrives from the sun’s light to stand before one.

**Chitong** – Lunar Soul
*Mysterious Flame* (Black Emperor): Chengqinting, styled Xuan Lüyan, appears as an infant clad in black jade brocade, with a black feathered floral flying skirt and a dark mountain dawn crown. He comes from the sun’s light to stand above one’s left hand.

*Symbolic Brilliance* (Yellow Emperor): Shouyifu, styled Yihui, appears as before, clad in yellow jade brocade, with a yellow feathered floral flying skirt and a mulberry dawn crown. He arrives from the sun’s light to stand above one’s right hand.

Once the invocations are complete, close the eyes and gaze upon the sunlight. Clench the fists and lower the hands, visualizing the five-colored floating mists within the sun. The radiance shimmers: azure on the left, vermilion on the right, white above, black below, and yellow at the center. Within these five hues, *qi* intermingles and reflects, all converging upon the body. From the feet to the nape, streaming mists of five colors enter the mouth. The flowing radiance, initially emanating from the sun, blends with its light to suffuse the entire body from head to foot.

Next, visualize within the radiant mist a vermilion *qi*, large as a child’s eye, suspended in clusters of dozens. Amidst the resplendent five colors, focus on forty-five of these, known as the *Flying Root Water Mother*. Silently invoke them thrice, drawing them with the five-colored *qi* into the mouth. Open the mouth and inhale, sensing the mouth fill. Facing the sun, swallow the mist forty-five times. With each inhalation of flowing mist, a *Flying Root* enters and is swallowed together.

Nine swallows enter the liver, nine the lungs, nine the heart, nine the kidneys, and nine the spleen. Visualize the entire body, inside and out, organs and navel alike, suffused with radiant light, the mist penetrating completely. After a long while, the visualization concludes.

Then swallow saliva nine times, knock the teeth nine times, and softly recite the incantation:
*"Vermilion furnace, cinnabar *qi*, the Dark Heavens nurture essence.
The firm receives the yielding, the flame’s yin blossom.
The sun’s primal radiance is called Great Clarity.
Nine yangs transform as one, the two images arise together.
Congealing soul and harmonizing spirit, the essence of the five *qi*.
At the center, the Five Emperors are born, riding light to govern form.
Gathering the flying numinous, plucking the root to attain fullness.
Within the head, the dragon harmonizes; clad in vermilion, girded in azure.
The reins of the crow flow dark, the mist illumines the *Shangqing*.
Bestowed the jade writ, the Golden Watchtower engraves the name.
Ingesting the morning’s blossom, merging with the true Dao’s numen.
Flying immortal of the *Taiwei*, ascending to the Purple Court.
Hasten, hasten, as decreed by statute and ordinance."*

After the incantation, bow twice toward the sun. On overcast days without sun, perform this in a clean space within a chamber, visualizing the practice. For those of pure cultivation and profound attainment, success comes naturally without awaiting the sun’s appearance—though practicing in its presence remains most efficacious.

**The *Taiwei* Method of Ingesting Solar *Qi* and the Luminous Numinous Talisman**
On the last day of the lunar month at dawn, face east and burn incense. Write in vermilion on azure paper, carefully inscribing the talisman’s strokes to resemble the original. The talisman’s form follows this text; others are to be modeled likewise. Face east to swallow it, thereby informing the solar soul.

No talisman should be prepared in advance; write it at the moment of ingestion. Hold the breath, grasp the talisman in the left hand, and recite the incantation:
*"The *Taiwei*’s cinnabar writ is called *Opening Clarity*.
Summon the sun’s upper soul to transform this form.
By day, adorned in solemn splendor, issuing from the profound.
The courtyard’s flying blossom-water, the sun’s root, golden essence.
Purple radiance flowing light, named the Five Numinous."*

After the incantation, roll the talisman into a pellet with the left hand and swallow it, visualizing it entering the heart.

**The *Shangqing* Method of Ingesting the Moon’s Radiance and the Stone Mirror Water Mother**
Practice this each evening at moonrise. Knock the teeth ten times and silently invoke the names of the lunar spirit and the characters of the Five Empresses within the moon. Next, visualize the Five Empresses seated in the moon according to the five colors, riding light to stand at the left, right, front, back, and above the hands.

The lunar spirit is the essence of the moon, the yellow *qi* within it. The Most August Divine Mother, named Yaodaoyou, styled Wang Huiliao, must not be casually invoked.

**Xuanxiao** – Lunar Spirit
*Fragrant Splendor* (Green Empress): Ehunzhu, styled Fenyan, appears as an infant clad in azure floral damask, with a kingfisher dragon-phoenix flying skirt and a three-cornered cloud bun atop the head, the rest of her hair cascading to her arms.

*Hidden Radiance* (Red Empress): Yiyiliao, styled Kuai Yianxu, appears as before, clad in cinnabar medicinal jade brocade, with a vermilion phoenix-net flying skirt, her hair arranged as above, standing to the right facing left.

*Mystic Orchid* (White Empress): Lingsulan, styled Yulianhua, clad in white forest four-dragon damask, with a crimson feathered luan-patterned flying skirt, her hair arranged as above.

*Knot of Gold* (Black Empress): Jieqiao, styled Chunshujin, clad in black jade nine-colored numinous brocade, with a black feathered dragon-patterned flying skirt, her hair arranged as above, standing above the right hand facing the face.

*Luminous Radiance* (Yellow Empress): Qingyingjin, styled Jiong Rong, clad in yellow-cloud mountain-patterned brocade, with a green-feathered phoenix-embroidered skirt, her hair arranged as before, standing to the left facing forward.

*White Standard* and *Moon Essence*—each name called in succession; when the invocation is complete, close the eyes, clasp the hands firmly, and let them hang at the sides. Visualize the five-colored flowing essence of the moon descending to envelop the entire body, from the feet to the crown of the head. Then, see the crystalline moonlight of five hues entering the mouth. Within the crystalline light, further visualize a yellow *qi*, vast as a child’s eye, in linked clusters of dozens. Amid the five-colored moonlight, perceive fifty luminous orbs named *Flying Cinnabar Crystals*; silently invoke them three times, and with the breath, draw them into the mouth. Facing the moon, swallow the crystals fifty times—with each inhalation, let the flowing essence and one *Flying Yellow* enter the mouth and be consumed.

Ten swallows enter the liver, ten the lungs, ten the heart, ten the kidneys, ten the spleen. Then visualize the five viscera and limbs, inside and out, suffused with clarity, merging with the flowing essence for a long while. When complete, swallow saliva ten times and click the teeth ten times.

Recite the incantation softly:
*Yellow essence, mysterious radiance,*
*Primal yin, ascending qi.*
*Dispel stagnant cold, refine the numinous, gather the stomach.*
*Empty waves, sharp brilliance,*
*Upright, cleansed, still vessel.*
*Moon crystal, night’s splendor,*
*Mysterious palace, supreme treasure.*
*Five Palace Ladies, each guard your mother’s throne.*
*Crimson heaven flies in, Infant Maiden follows.*
*Four yin, three unions, light shines in ten thousand directions.*
*Harmonize the hun, restrain the po, five wombs flow with light.*
*Ride the clouds, fly with essence, soar in emptiness to the east.*
*At the crown, bind the numinous cloud,*
*May fortune favor the wind.*
*Left, gird the tiger tally; right, wear the dragon insignia.*
*Phoenix-feather cloud mantle, jade pendants, golden earrings.*
*Soaring tree, branches entwined, named Wood King.*
*Divine canopy roots the stem—waning and waxing.*
*Bright essence responds within, mysterious water exhales fragrance.*
*Granted a jade tablet, name carved in the Cloud Chamber.*
*Ingest moon’s radiance, merge with the Perfected.*

Then, facing due north, shout "Swift!" once, release the talisman, and recite the incantation:

With each recitation, shout once. Administer the water for washing, then draw the fire *qi* from the sun and exhale it onto the eyes.

For all cases of unbearable headaches:
Inscribe the Three Lights Talisman and affix it to the temples.

For all cases where malaria demons cause obstruction:
Inscribe the Three Lights Talisman on a cake and have the afflicted consume it. Recite the talismanic incantation:
*You appear as a black sorrowful ghost—I know your name. Depart swiftly a thousand leagues, and do not linger for even a moment.*
Then draw the Three Lights *qi*, spray it, and have the afflicted ingest the Three Lights Talisman.

For all cases of prolonged labor where the child has not descended, risking life:
Have the mother ingest the Three Lights Talisman. Visualize the Three Lights Great Sage standing before her, followed by the thunder, lightning, and fire chariots, demon-quelling officials, and divine soldiers overseeing the birth. Envision the talisman-bearer as a talismanic officer, holding the talisman and command to proceed. Immediately summon the thunder, lightning, fire chariot, and birth-overseeing deities to follow the talisman into the mother’s mouth, ensuring swift delivery.

For all cases where demonic entities manifest malevolence to harm the living:
Affix the Three Lights Demon-Quelling Talisman to the door. If the affliction clings to a person or livestock, consecrate water and spray it.

For all cases of long-standing sores and abscesses:
Burn the Three Lights Talisman to ash and apply it to the afflicted area. Alternatively, cover the sore with the talisman or ingest it. For unbroken sores, silently recite the Celestial Pillar incantation seven times, drawing *qi* seven times to blow onto the sore, which will naturally resolve and discharge.

For all cases of crossing rivers or seas where water spirits encircle the vessel, causing harm and refusing to depart, or making unreasonable demands that induce terror:
Draw the Upright *Qi* of the Celestial Pillar onto an iron blade, inscribe the Three Lights Talisman, and cast it into the water.

For all cases of unresolved ailments:
Ingest the Three Lights Talisman. Depending on the illness, dissolve it in decoction to expel pathogenic *qi*, or add the Demon-Quelling Talisman. Use a seven-inch peach twig from the southeast, boiled in water for ingestion. Alternatively, consecrated water or burning the talisman in a cup for consumption may also be used.

**Method for Gathering Pillar Water**
The Pillar is the innate fire within *yin*, capable of destroying all evil. To gather Pillar Water is to conceal its power and await its use.

On the Double Fifth Festival during heavy rain, place a vessel in the direction of the Celestial Canopy (*huagai*) at the following hours: *zi* (11 PM–1 AM) for the first year, *mao* (5–7 AM) for the second, *you* (5–7 PM) for the third, and *zi* again for the fifth. If no rain falls, collect well water at noon and store it—this is called Pillar Water.

Another method: On days of Heavenly Virtue or Monthly Virtue, or the *chou* day (2–4 AM) of each month, or the day of Brahmin descent, collect water from the Celestial Canopy direction during rainfall. This is called Dharma Water, to be used only after offering.

**Method for Harmonizing the Three Lights Elixir**
Take a steamed bun, remove the skin and base, leaving only the center (where nothing congregates). Divide it into two pieces: dry one piece and soak the other until soft. These represent *yin* and *yang*. Knead them together until extremely sticky. Recite the incantation any number of times, drawing *qi* to exhale onto the mixture. Visualize the left hand as the sun, the right as the moon, and the exhaled *qi* as the Pillar. Shape the dough into cakes, flipping them repeatedly while inscribing the Three Lights Talisman on top any number of times. Once complete, form pills of varying sizes, each infused with the Three Lights *qi* and a recitation of the incantation.

As the text states: *If this method is followed, merely blowing onto the steamed bun seventy times will turn it crimson like cinnabar, resistant to fading. Its efficacy is extraordinary. Form it into fine pills for ingestion—this is the Three Lights Elixir. If a talisman is cast into a well at the first watch of dawn, the well water will boil. Test it to witness its divine efficacy.*

When subduing sorrow or exorcising malevolent forces, first visualize a Dipper above the crown, its mouth covering the body. The Pillar extends forward, stepping upon another Dipper, with the Pillar hanging below, flanked by two additional Dippers. The elbows align with *Tanlang* (Greedy Wolf), the shoulders with *Juxu* (Giant Gate), the heart with *Lu* (Salary), the clenched hands with *Wenqu* (Literary Brilliance). The left hand descends to the right waist, the right hand to the left waist, forming *Lianzhen* (Integrity) and *Wuqu* (Military Brilliance). The feet align with *Pojun* (Breaker of Armies). The Pillar’s radiance intermingles, with the master standing amidst the firelight, crowned by a Dipper above and borne by a Dipper below.

**Flying the Dipper**
With the left hand, thrust the *zi-wu* (midnight-noon) axis to the left. With the right hand, thrust the *yin-wu* (tiger-noon) and *chou* (ox) axes to the rear, forming the left as the *yang* Dipper and the cloud of *Tanlang*. Visualize black stellar light emanating from beneath the right foot, coiling upward around the left side to crown the head, then projecting as a red stellar light.

Red light emanates from beneath the left foot, coiling upward along the right side to crown the head, then projecting from the crown. The right hand’s *zi-wu* Dipper thrusts to the left. The *yin-wu* Dipper thrusts to the right. The right forms the *yin* Dipper, from *Kui* to *Pi*. Next, the *chen-xu* Dipper caps the head, with the Three Terraces layered above.

**Three Terraces Dipper Incantation**
Upper Terrace: *Xu Jing* (Void Essence), *si* (Serpent).
Preserve my thousand-year lifespan.
Middle Terrace: *Liu Chun* (Sixfold Purity), *wu* (Horse).
Guard my bodily form.
Lower Terrace: *Qu Sheng* (Crooked Life), *wei* (Sheep).
I bow in homage to the Three Clarities.

**The Orthodox Rites of the Northern Culmen’s Celestial Heart are complete.**

chunks.original_text: 凡入患家丁罡九，自身存为元始王。 南方九凤吐真火，烧毁患宅皆灰扬。 震风一吹皆清净，化为楼殿金华堂。 人物皆化天仙子，楼殿下有九鳖翔。 戴起楼台俱紫雾，金光万道迸扶桑。 四面俱为大海水，波涛涌沸无四方。 洪浪万顷无舟楫，我方入去运天罡。 化身元始领甲兵，玄中正一侍吾身。 四圣三官并将吏，六甲六丁齐降临。 青龙白虎并朱雀，玄武麒麟师凤翔。 雷电交轰俱前入，我身五斗挟藏魂。 天罡赤炁前开道，铁网交加上下缯。 十面八方皆兵将，旅帜幢旛列万兵。 叩齿集神运三炁，诵咒煞鬼自然灵。 变巨海诀，掐亥勒上甲，至四三二指甲下。 挑出化为巨海，渺渺茫茫，洪波万顷，宅四畔皆为大海。 次虚皇台诀，大指掐丑，勒上至午，挑出化居屋，为神仙官阙，十二步丁歪。 嘤水三口，喝变三声，闭目存己身，宅为十二楼台。 骨肉尽化为神仙，玉女在上游宴，下有巨鳖，乘载往来，海水深无定。 次掐舟楫诀，大指掐寅，顺转至亥，挑出存海无舟楫，鬼神无路。 次四方发连天铁障诀，右手仰，左手覆，右手二指甲掐左手二指根，左手大指掐右手三指从右手四指背过恰中指中掐四指上节，五指掐左手五指甲背，曲直右手二指，存铁障亘天连地，隔断邪祟，无路而入。 若法师出，乘黑云度海，化铁障，前开后合。 乃二足并立，前开后合。 净坛咒 天上地下，大力天丁。 辅助吾法，扫荡妖氛。 秽炁速灭，荡涤妖氛。 坛场速浄，道炁长存。 急急如律令。 左手煞文，取天门炁，入水洒净。 诤身咒 上真玄灵，五斗覆身。 神清气爽，荡秽安宁。 急急如太上律令。 左手药叉印，诀取天门炁吹之。 诤心咒 五炁正灵，乾象变化。 翊卫辅佐，心神无差。 急急如太上律令。 左手天心诀，从三指格掌心。 变形咒 三天之令，化吾之形。 青龙白虎，侍卫我身。 邪鬼远遁，真炁速生。 急急如太上律令。 左手天心诀，右手斗印，想身如天师状。 藏魂入斗咒 吾受天师心宝印，佩受自然，通幽达冥，上彻洞天。 吾行禹步，愿得升仙。 三魂童子，左手三台诀，取三光炁，存三台居左肩，谓之三魂。 七魄真人。 右手北斗诀，第三指尖吸七口炁，有七星居右府，谓之七魄。 随吾禹步，愿度灵关。 急急如律令。

A single gust from the Thunder Wind purifies all, transforming it into a towering palace—the Hall of Golden Splendor. Its inhabitants become celestial immortals, and beneath the palace, nine giant turtles soar. The lofty towers are wreathed in purple mist, while myriad golden rays burst forth from Fusang.

The Orthodox Unity of the Mysterious Center attends my body, while the Four Saints, the Three Officials, and the marshals, along with the Six Jia and Six Ding spirits, all descend. The Azure Dragon, White Tiger, Vermilion Bird, Dark Warrior, Qilin, and Master Phoenix soar forth. Thunder and lightning clash as they advance before me, while my body, imbued with the Five Pecks of qi, conceals the hun-souls.

On all ten sides and eight directions, soldiers and generals stand arrayed, their banners and standards lining the ranks of ten thousand troops. Clasp the *hai* position, press the upper *jia* to the fourth, third, and second fingernails below. Flick outward to manifest a vast sea, boundless and indistinct, its waves spanning ten thousand leagues, encircling the dwelling on all sides.

Above in heaven, below on earth,
Mighty Heavenly Ding spirits,
Assist my Dharma,
Sweep away demonic miasma.
Foul qi swiftly perish,
Demonic miasma cleansed.
May the altar be swiftly purified,
The Dao’s qi eternally abide.
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and ordinance!*

**Left Hand’s Slaying Mudra:**
Draw the qi of the Heavenly Gate, enter water, and sprinkle to purify.

**Purification of the Body Incantation:**
Supreme Perfected, Mysterious Numinous,
Five Pecks of qi cover my body.
Spirit clear, qi refreshed,
Foulness dispelled, peace restored.
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the Most High’s statutes and ordinances!*

Form the mudra, draw the qi of the Heavenly Gate, and blow.

Five qi, true and numinous,
Heaven’s image transforms.
Assist and guard,
Heart and spirit unerring.
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the Most High’s statutes and ordinances!*

**Left Hand’s Celestial Heart Mudra:**
From the third finger, press into the palm’s center.

**Transformation of Form Incantation:**
By the decree of the Three Heavens,
Transform my form.
Azure Dragon, White Tiger,
Attend and guard my body.
Evil ghosts flee afar,
True qi swiftly arises.
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the Most High’s statutes and ordinances!*

**Left Hand’s Celestial Heart Mudra, Right Hand’s Dipper Seal:**
Visualize oneself in the likeness of the Heavenly Master.

**Concealing the Hun-Souls into the Dipper Incantation:**
I receive the Heavenly Master’s Heart Treasure Seal,
Endowed by nature,
Communing with the hidden and reaching the netherworld,
Ascending through the grotto-heavens.
I tread the Yu step, aspiring to transcendence.
Three Hun Spirits,

Seven Po Immortals,
*Right hand forms the Northern Dipper Mudra,*

**Celestial Heart Orthodox Dharma Seal and Talismanic Script**
**The True Talisman of the Heavenly Stem Great Sage for Exorcising Ghosts by Imperial Decree**

As the Daoist scriptures state: The Heavenly Stem Great Sage is invoked to repel disasters for the state. When the sun and moon lose their proper course, when comets appear in daylight, when drought, flood, locusts, or pestilence rage, when malevolent spirits and ghosts enter the land or manifest, when grotesque and monstrous forms invade human dwellings, hurling bricks and tiles, summoning winds and setting fires, bewildering the living—then inscribe the True Form Talisman of the Heavenly Stem. Visualize the Breaker of Armies, aligning it correctly as prescribed.

On the preceding night, prepare incense, flowers, wine, and fruit to honor the Heavenly Stem Great Sage, and leave brush and ink exposed beneath the talisman. At dawn, banish all extraneous thoughts, purify body and mind, and inscribe the talisman according to the method.

**The "Heaven" Character Form**
**The "Stem" Character Form**
**The "Great" Character Form**
**The "Sage" Character Form**
**The "Decree" Character Form**
**The "Slay" Character Form**

While inscribing the talisman, recite the Heavenly Stem Mantra and Decree. Visualize the true *qi* of the Heavenly Regulator, the Star of the Demon-Quelling Venerable, entering the talisman. Clasp the Stem and Eye mudras.

For warding homes and expelling evil, this method yields profound efficacy. Alternatively, hand over the talisman, spray water, and clench the Sword Mudra, declaring:

*"Celestial Spirit, Earthly Spirit,
The Three and Five conjoin in harmony.
By Imperial Decree I act,
To scrutinize and bind wayward spirits.
Direct-Day Merit Officers,
Attending officials and marshals,
Delay not, tarry not—
Hasten forth, return swiftly,
For I await in command."*

**Next, Circulate the Thunder Formation**

*"Heavenly Thunder rumbles low—*Zi.
*Earth Thunder, Yin Thunder, Yang Thunder—*
Thunder’s might stirs and shakes.
Dragon and Tiger cross paths,
Sun and Moon array in order—*Yin.
Radiance shines clear—*Mao.
Twelve Merit Officers—*Chen.
Five Thunder Envoys,
Six Jia and Six Ding,
Bear the talisman forth—*Wu Tiao.
Swift as law commands!"*

**First Revolution:** Six Spirits conceal—*Yin* to *Mao.*
**Second Revolution:** Four Malevolents vanish—*Chen.*
**Third Revolution:** The Stem and Culmen move—*Wu.*
**Fourth Revolution:** Thunderfire surges—*Zi.*
**Fifth Revolution:** Thunderbolts strike—*You.*
**Sixth Revolution:** Mountain ghosts perish—*Xu.*
**Seventh Revolution:** All rebels against Heaven, all lawless specters with severed feet, are seized.

*"Whatever demonic affliction plagues this body,
Come before my Stem and Culmen,
Beneath the Five Thunders,
To meet your death—
Move not, act not!
Swift as law commands!"*

**Mantra and Mudra for Circulating the Thunder Formation**
When circulating thunder, use the mudra to stir the Kidney Palace, raising the Kidney Water upward while the Heart Fire’s red *qi* descends, merging with the Kidney *qi*. The two *qi* blend and fuse, generating thunder and lightning.

Circulate with both hands in the Thunder Formation, guiding it to the crown of the head. Extend the mudra, cover the ears to produce thunder, flash the eyes thrice for lightning, exhale through the nose for wind, expel breath from the mouth for clouds, and spray water thrice for rain.

Send forth the talisman with the dispatching mudra, transforming and invoking the talismanic water. The bearer becomes a Heavenly Ding Warrior or the Direct-Day Merit Officer. For hastening childbirth, the bearer becomes the Hastening Birth Lad or the Birth-Supervising Great Spirit. The talisman-bearer must not pause or rest along the way.

**Ancient Three Lights Talisman**
Before inscribing the talisman, sit facing the Destruction Palace, cast the *Zi-Wu* Dipper, and cover the body as prescribed. Invoke *qi* into the cinnabar inkwell, visualizing radiance filling the vessel. Recite the incantation:

*"The Great Sun shines true,
Evil ghosts wane in its light.
Divine cinnabar gleams bright as day,
Ninefold dew from the Supreme Canopy.
Three *qi* form the Terrace,
Seven *qi* form the Dipper.
Both stars shine forth—
Where the talisman arrives, pursuit is certain.
Ink becomes the divine sword,
Brush the halberd and glaive.
Inkstone the Dragon Pool,
Water the Dragon Ford.
By brushwork, illness is cured,
All evil vanishes.
As the law commands!"*

Next, clasp the Sun Lord Mudra at the upper joint of the left middle finger.

**Round Radiance, Square Image, Round Shadow Talisman**
Recite the Sun Mantra. Visualize the purple *qi* of the sun, nine-rayed, blown into the talisman with the *Tiao* mudra.
Recite the Moon Mantra. Visualize the white *qi* of the moon, ten-rayed, blown into the talisman with the *Tiao* mudra.
Seven revolutions.
Recite from *Kui* to *Piao*. Clasp the *Chen* mudra, draw the Stem into the talisman.
Upon completing the form, recite the invocation for the Heavenly Stem Great Sage to descend, infusing the true *qi* into the ghost’s heart.

The *Shangqing* Method of Ingesting the Flying Root and Vermilion Essence Golden Elixir

Each day at the hour of solar culmination, face the sun with eyes slightly opened. Knock the teeth nine times, silently invoke the names of the solar soul and the characters of the Five Emperors within the sun. With hands clasped, call forth the solar soul.

The Five Emperors sit according to the five directions, with the sun at their center. The solar soul is the essence of the sun, the vermilion *qi* within it. The Most August True Lord, named General, styled Gaoqian, must not be casually invoked—know him through visualization.

**Zhujing** – Solar Soul
*Illuminating Radiance* (Green Emperor): Yuanchangwu, styled Zhaotao, appears as an infant clad in azure jade brocade, with a verdant floral flying feather skirt and a kingfisher-feathered dawn crown. He rides the sunlight to stand at one’s left.

*Vermilion Glow* (Red Emperor): Danlingzhi, styled Lü Hongying, appears as an infant clad in crimson jade brocade, with a white feathered floral flying skirt and a cinnabar dawn crown. He emerges from the sun’s rays to stand at one’s right.

*Returning Radiance* (White Emperor): Haoyujiang, styled Huijin Xia, appears as an infant clad in white jade brocade, with a white feathered floral flying skirt and a luminous dawn crown. He arrives from the sun’s light to stand before one.

**Chitong** – Lunar Soul
*Mysterious Flame* (Black Emperor): Chengqinting, styled Xuan Lüyan, appears as an infant clad in black jade brocade, with a black feathered floral flying skirt and a dark mountain dawn crown. He comes from the sun’s light to stand above one’s left hand.

*Symbolic Brilliance* (Yellow Emperor): Shouyifu, styled Yihui, appears as before, clad in yellow jade brocade, with a yellow feathered floral flying skirt and a mulberry dawn crown. He arrives from the sun’s light to stand above one’s right hand.

Once the invocations are complete, close the eyes and gaze upon the sunlight. Clench the fists and lower the hands, visualizing the five-colored floating mists within the sun. The radiance shimmers: azure on the left, vermilion on the right, white above, black below, and yellow at the center. Within these five hues, *qi* intermingles and reflects, all converging upon the body. From the feet to the nape, streaming mists of five colors enter the mouth. The flowing radiance, initially emanating from the sun, blends with its light to suffuse the entire body from head to foot.

Next, visualize within the radiant mist a vermilion *qi*, large as a child’s eye, suspended in clusters of dozens. Amidst the resplendent five colors, focus on forty-five of these, known as the *Flying Root Water Mother*. Silently invoke them thrice, drawing them with the five-colored *qi* into the mouth. Open the mouth and inhale, sensing the mouth fill. Facing the sun, swallow the mist forty-five times. With each inhalation of flowing mist, a *Flying Root* enters and is swallowed together.

Nine swallows enter the liver, nine the lungs, nine the heart, nine the kidneys, and nine the spleen. Visualize the entire body, inside and out, organs and navel alike, suffused with radiant light, the mist penetrating completely. After a long while, the visualization concludes.

Then swallow saliva nine times, knock the teeth nine times, and softly recite the incantation:
*"Vermilion furnace, cinnabar *qi*, the Dark Heavens nurture essence.
The firm receives the yielding, the flame’s yin blossom.
The sun’s primal radiance is called Great Clarity.
Nine yangs transform as one, the two images arise together.
Congealing soul and harmonizing spirit, the essence of the five *qi*.
At the center, the Five Emperors are born, riding light to govern form.
Gathering the flying numinous, plucking the root to attain fullness.

Every talisman contains yin and yang. The brush holds the *Gang* (Celestial Stem), the brush bears flying fire. The left hand gathers, the right hand guides; conceal the talismanic aperture. Then burn incense, invoke the deities, and make offerings. Once the petition is complete, begin writing. Visualize the brush as a dragon, the inkstone as a vast sea, the ink as an iron mountain, the cinnabar as a hundred medicines, the cinnabar dish as a fire pool, the paper as an iron plate. When the visualization is complete, one must also know the yin-yang days.

To ingest the true *qi* of the sun, do so each day at dawn. If unable to practice daily, perform it on the 3rd, 5th, 7th, 9th, 11th, 13th, 15th, 17th, 19th, and 21st days of the lunar month. At sunrise, face east toward the sun. If an eclipse occurs, wait until it passes, then set out incense, bow twice, gaze directly at the sun, and press both hands to the heart in reverence. The sun’s rising is not always due east—face wherever it appears. Even if it stands three *zhang* high, it may still be ingested. If the sun is not visible at dawn, or if practicing in a dim chamber, the moment of sunrise is especially potent. Follow the previous method to request the *qi* and proceed accordingly.

When drawing the *qi*, visualize the Seven Stars of the Dipper askew, reaching the seventh star, then silently recite the Six Jia of the Four Seasons.

Upon completing the incantation, visualize a single step of the *Ding Gang*, facing the direction of the sun, ensuring the *Ding Gang* remains aligned with the first star. With the left hand forming the Solar Lord’s mudra, recite the Solar Lord’s incantation seven times. Envision a golden world wherein a crimson *qi* appears, resplendent as fire. It resembles a golden basin, its five-colored radiance descending into the nose. Draw it in, swallow, and click the teeth nine times. Silently recite the Solar incantation seven times, then inhale through the left nostril, guiding the *qi* downward. Imagine the solar *qi* descending directly from the *Chonglou* to the *Weilu* cavity, ascending along the spine to the brain’s *Niwan* Palace, then flowing downward through the five viscera and six bowels, suffusing the four limbs entirely. Sense the five-colored brilliance emanating from every pore and orifice. Next, visualize it settling in the lower *Dantian*, motionless as a luminous pellet. Slowly exhale the turbid *qi*; once the breath steadies, inhale and swallow as before. Repeat this three times, then bow three times to the sun. For further details, consult the general treatise.

**On the Lunar *Qi***
When ingesting the true *qi* of the moon, choose a clear evening when the sky is limpid. Begin after the third day of the lunar month, or during the waning phase once the moon’s brightness wanes. If not practiced regularly, perform on the 2nd, 4th, 6th, 8th, 10th, 12th, 14th, 16th, 18th, 20th, 22nd, or 24th day. Alternatively, await the moon’s first appearance at dusk or nightfall. For the 2nd or 3rd day, use the sun’s initial degree. On the last day of the lunar month or the new moon, take the *qi* at sunset. If a lunar eclipse occurs, wait until it passes. Face the moon, set out incense, and burn it while gazing directly at the moon, pressing both hands to the heart in reverence. Even if the moon stands three or four *zhang* high, it may still be ingested—follow the illustrated method precisely.

For example, begin counting from *you*: *you* (1), *shen* (2), *wei* (3), *wu* (2), *si* (3), *chen* (2), *mao* (3), *yin* (2), *chou* (3), *zi* (2), *hai* (3), *xu* (2). After two days, return to *you*. Then, add *you* to the day’s branch to determine the moon’s position at the chosen time. For instance, on the 3rd day at the *zi* hour: starting from the 1st day (*you* 3), the moon is in *shen*. At the *zi* hour, add *you* to *shen*, counting forward: *xu* (in *you*), *hai* (in *xu*), *zi* (in *hai*), so the moon resides in *hai*. Face the moon’s rising direction, form the Lunar Lord’s mudra, and visualize a silver world wherein a white *qi* appears, lustrous as warm jade. It resembles a silver platter, its radiance streaming directly into the nostrils. Upon reciting the Lunar Lord’s incantation, inhale through the right nostril as before, guiding the *qi* downward to the *Dantian*. Exhale the turbid *qi*, then bow three times with a settled mind.

**On the Celestial Stem (*Tiangang*)**
Also called the *Living Luminaries of Heaven* or the *Secret Art of Entering the Dipper*.
In ancient times, the Yellow Emperor resided within Yuecheng when a Perfected Lord descended from the void, manifesting in his true form—nine *chi* tall, crowned with a starry diadem, and girded with a sword. He addressed the Yellow Emperor: “I bestow upon you the method of the *Living Luminaries of Heaven*, through which you shall achieve great victory.” Having spoken, he vanished. The Yellow Emperor later employed this method, slaying Chiyou and decisively defeating the Qiangrong tribes—its efficacy defies description. The Emperor then enshrined the divine talismans in the Hall of Spirits at Huayang Palace, concealing them within the Tai’ping Observatory. The *Qi*-Emperor Immortals preserved and transmitted them to the present age.

During the Later Han, Jiang Anguo frequently used this talisman to vanquish treachery and evil. When enemy forces besieged a city, the sight of the Seven Stars ascending the emperor’s throne would cause weapons to retreat of their own accord. chunks.original_text: 此法又号水火既济本法，用寅卯时，平坐偃身，一撞三关，闻息良久，觉水火降升，要举动导引，默运心炁上升。 役使天罡法咒曰： 谨请天歪大神，速降真灵。 上朝金阙，下覆昆仑。 手持宝剑，搜斩邪精。 行神布炁，去病灭疼。 或咒果子，咒水治病，不可轻泄，妄传非人。 普施三光符水 一凡有邪祟妖怪染着，不能通言解醒。 念天罡咒，入水取罡炁，吸水噀其面，令病者服符，及三光煞鬼符，烧入水中吞。 一凡有瘟疫日服正炁，渐以安宁。 一凡有赤眼闭明，以变神掐斗诀，午文亦得。 次掐上帝诀，入斗印，取三光，吹笔书符，取炁咒水。 符浸水中，令病人洗眼，仍用斗诀，向正喝一声疾，发符念咒。 唵嚩□哩液□咤，尔是李公仲，缘何来我家？ 一念每一喝，即喝之。 付水与洗，仍向日取火炁呵之。 一凡有头痛不可忍者，当书三光符贴太阳穴。 一凡有疟鬼作梗者，书三光符於饼上，令食之。 书符咒曰：汝是形如黑忧鬼，吾知汝姓名，速速去千里，不得稍留停。 复取三光炁喷之，以三光符与吞。 一凡有生产，经日未下十死一生者，书三光符吞服，存三光大圣立前，次存雷电火车、煞鬼吏兵同监生大神等，存捧符人为符吏，赍持符命前去。 以立待雷电火车监生大神，随符入产人口中，立即生下。 一凡有鬼精作凶怪，以压害生人。 以三光煞鬼符贴门上，如着人身及六畜，咒水噀之。 一凡有疮疖久疼，以三光符烧灰贴之。 或以符覆之，或吞之。 或未破者，默念天罡咒七褊，取炁七过吹之，自然消溃。 一凡渡江涉海，有水怪绕船，作害不去，妄有求取而作惊恐者，取天罡正炁於铁剖上，书三光符掷水中。 一凡有百病未安，皆以三光符服之。 随病用汤吞下应邪炁，加煞鬼符，用东南方桃枝七寸，煎汤下。 或咒水皆可，或烧符在盏内服之。 收罡水法 罡者，阴中自然之火，破灭万邪。 凡收罡水，乃藏威而待之。 凡遇重午日大雨时，於华盖方，正子二年三卯四酉五复子。 下置水器收之。 若无雨，即於午时取井华水收之，谓之罡水。 又法：以天德月德日，每月丑日，若婆罗门下降日，已上是也。 遇天雨时，亦於华盖方收之。 谓之法水，皆祭而后用。 和合三光丹法 每一蒸饼，去皮并底，用心中，无所聚也。 分作二片，乾一片，用水浸烂一片，两片阴阳也。 一处两搓搜，令极黏腻，不计褊数念咒，取炁嘘之。 仍先想左手为日，右手为月，口嘘炁为罡。 捍作饼子翻覆，褊写三光符在上，不计徧数。 毕，随大小丸之，每一粒各存三光炁，咒一褊。 格云：若依此法，但将蒸饼吹之七七徧，其色如丹，久而难白，其灵尤妙，细丸之，与人吞服，日三光丹。 若书符投井中，五更初投符时，井水俱沸，试之即知神验矣。 存想真人形配衣式 凡伏哀问祟行持，先存顶上一座斗，以斗口罩身，罡在前出履一斗，垂罡在下，而两斗乘之，左右挟辅各一斗。 并以肘贪狼肩巨，问心为禄，存所握手处为文曲，左手即落，右腰右手即落，左腰为廉贞，为武曲，足前为破军。 罡光交焕，师在火光中，上有斗罩，下有斗乘也。 飞斗左手，子午挑出左边。 右手寅午，牛挑在后，左为阳斗云贪狼。 存想黑星光，自右足下发，绕左边直上，罩头顶上，出存红星。
